primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transition of the believer from the status of a 'slave' (ignorant, dehumanized) to a 'friend' (informed, intimate, heir) through the speech-act and relational initiative of Jesus Christ.

tekstueel_bewijs: all things that I have heard of my Father I have made known unto you

tekstueel_bewijs: the awareness that I belong to Christ

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (implied) and the 'Artist's Sketch' (Revelation/Scripture)
tekstueel_bewijs: John has given us an artist's sketch
the Voice I hear falling on my ear

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just personal sin but a systemic, historical power that seeks to steal humanity and keep the Subject in the dark.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the church to its new status: voting, building, and maintaining fellowship.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church/Hearers
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The 'New Title' (Primary) provides the dignity required for the 'Protest/Voting' (Secondary).

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the transition from ignorance (Slave) to knowledge (Friend). Grace is presented as the gift of 'knowing the Master's heart'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (historical slavery) through ~S1 (political dehumanization) to S1 (Christ's declaration of friendship).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ's performative word: 'I call you friends.'
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; slavery is treated as a literal and ontological death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. The change in the hearer's status is not earned by 'doing' but is a gift of 'being called' by Jesus. Even the call to vote is framed as a consequence of the dignity God has already restored.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the initiator of status
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus did not give people titles downward; he gave them titles upward.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The ancestors are used as models of resilience, but their strength is attributed to God's sustaining power.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already leans theocentric by focusing on 'Look what God hath wrought' rather than 'Look what they did'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Restoration of dignity and hope; relief from the burden of 'not knowing'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification is an ascription of value by God that precedes human action.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical reality of slavery to the spiritual reality of friendship is masterfully handled.
spanning_punten: The jump from John 15 to New York City mayoral elections feels rhetorically abrupt but actantially consistent (Opponent check).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: I am a friend of Jesus Christ... he belongs to me.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses more on the Christological declaration than the Pneumatological indwelling.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as the power that dehumanizes and enslaves (both literally and spiritually).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions Jesus as the Subject who transforms the Hearer (Receiver) from a state of Bondage (Opponent) to Friendship (Object).

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the 'New Title' to the 'New Power' of the Spirit to live out that friendship.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of how to use historical trauma as a foil for the 'Grammar of Grace' without falling into mere moralism.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the Studebaker anecdote; Greimas shows the car's 'strong engine' is an actantial metaphor for the Subject's competence.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains 'doulos'; Greimas explains how 'doulos' functions as a 'lack of knowledge' in the narrative engine.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-Switch' where Jesus takes the initiative to rename the Receiver.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Savoir' (knowing) as the primary bridge between the Already and the Not Yet.
